title: Authors and Citation
text: Layton R, Long R, Ohland M, Orr M, Lord S (2024). midfielddata: MIDFIELD Data Sample. R package version 0.2.2, https://midfieldr.github.io/midfielddata/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {midfielddata: MIDFIELD Data Sample},   author = {Richard Layton and Russell Long and Matthew Ohland and Marisa Orr and Susan Lord},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.2.2},   url = {https://midfieldr.github.io/midfielddata/}, }

title: MIDFIELD Data Sample
text: Data “student-level” refers information collected undergraduate institutions individual students, including: course information, e.g., course name & number, credit hours, student grades term information, e.g., program, academic standing, grade point average student demographic information, e.g., age, sex, race/ethnicity degree information, e.g., institution, program, term, baccalaureate degree midfielddata provides anonymized student-level records 98,000 undergraduates three US institutions 1988 2018, collected four data tables keyed student ID. Table 1. Practice datasets midfielddata. data midfielddata proportionate stratified sample MIDFIELD database, suitable drawing inferences program attributes student experiences—midfielddata practice, research. Notes syntax.   use data.table data manipulation. users may prefer base R dplyr. system strengths—users welcome translate examples preferred syntax.
code: format(Sys.Date(), "%Y-%m-%d") # Today's date #> [1] "2024-11-30" packageVersion("midfielddata") # Student-level records practice data #> [1] '0.2.2' packageVersion("data.table") # For data manipulation #> [1] '1.15.4'

title: MIDFIELD Data Sample
text: Start.   writing script follow along, use packages vignette: Load data tables.   Data tables can loaded individually collectively needed. display records one specific student, using ID subset dataset. Student.   expected, student yields one row per student. Course.   student, records span 47 rows, one row per course. Term.   , records span 10 rows, one row per term. Degree.   example, records span 2 rows, one row per degree. degrees earned term, Spring 2009. students one degree earn term. example, next student earned degree 1996 second degree 1999. analyses, first baccalaureate degree used.
code: library(midfielddata) library(data.table) # Load one table as needed data(student)  # Or load multiple tables data(course, term, degree) # One student ID id_we_want <- "MCID3112192438" # Observations for a selected ID student[mcid == id_we_want] #>              mcid   institution              transfer hours_transfer  race #> 1: MCID3112192438 Institution C First-Time in College selected ID course[mcid == id_we_want] #>               mcid   institution term_course                         course #>  1: MCID3112192438 Institution C       20051 Key Academic Community Seminar #> MCID3112192438 Institution C       20093                    Group Study #>     abbrev number section         type              faculty_rank hours_course #>  1:     KA    192     009         <NA> term[mcid == id_we_want] #>               mcid   institution  term   cip6              level      standing #>  1: MCID3112192438 Institution C 20051 451101      01 First-year Good Standing #>  2: title: MIDFIELD Data Sample
text: Install : installed size midfielddata 24 Mb, installation take longer conventional CRAN package. Also size, package hosted CRAN (5 MB size limit)—instead, host MIDFIELDR drat repository indicated . Link installation instructions midfieldr .

title: MIDFIELD Data Sample
text: midfieldr companion R package provides tools methods studying undergraduate student-level records MIDFIELD database. MIDFIELD database anonymized student-level records approximately 2.4M undergraduates 21 US institutions 1987-2022. Access database requires confidentiality agreement Institutional Review Board (IRB) approval human subjects research. detailed description database, see (Ohland & Long, 2016).

title: MIDFIELD Data Sample
text: work supported US National Science Foundation grant numbers 1545667 2142087.

title: Student-level course data — course
text: Student-level course information approximately 98,000 undergraduates, keyed student ID. Data "student-level" refers information collected undergraduate institutions individual students, example, course name number, credit hours, student grades.

title: Student-level course data — course
text: data.frame data.table 12 variables approximately 3.3M observations 97,555 unique students occupying 325 MB memory: mcid Character, anonymized student identifier, e.g., MCID3111142225. institution Character, de-identified institution name, e.g., Institution , Institution B, etc. term_course Character, academic year term, format YYYYT. course Character, course name, e.g., Astrophysics III, Calculus Social Science Business, Corp Financial Rprtng 1, Environmental Sanitation II, Fitness Wellness, Introductory Astronomy 2, Changing Environment, etc. abbrev Character, course alpha identifier, e.g. AA, MATH, ACCT, EH, HES, ASTR, etc. number Character, course numeric identifier, e.g. 1104, 1209, 228, 4047, etc. section Character, course section identifier, one four characters, e.g., 1, 2, 01, 14, 001, 040, 785, H02, R01, 300E, 888R, etc. type Character, predominant delivery method section, e.g., Blended, Distance Education, Face--Face, Online, etc. faculty_rank Character, academic rank person teaching course, e.g., Assistant Professor, Associate Professor, Graduate Assistant, Visiting Faculty, etc. hours_course Numeric, number credit-hours successful course completion. grade Character, course grade, e.g., +, , -, B+, , NG, etc. discipline_midfield Character, variable grouping courses academic discipline assigned MIDFIELD data curator, e.g., Anthropology, Business, Computer Science, Engineering, Language Literature, Mathematics, Visual Performing Arts, etc.

title: Student-level course data — course
text: 2022 MIDFIELD database

title: Student-level course data — course
text: Course data structured block-record form, , records associated particular ID can span multiple rows—one record per student per course per term. Terms encoded YYYYT, YYYY year start academic year T encodes semester quarter within academic year Fall (1), Winter (2), Spring (3), Summer (4, 5, 6). example, academic year 1995–96, Fall 95–96 encoded 19951, Spring 95–96 encoded 19953, first Summer 95-96 term encoded 19954. source database includes special month-long sessions encoded letters , B, C, etc., though none included sample. possible values grade variable includes NG "grade given", W indicating withdrawal. example, lab course may mandatory co-requisite lecture course, grade given lecture course lab grade recorded NG. data midfielddata proportionate stratified sample MIDFIELD database, suitable drawing inferences program attributes student experiences—midfielddata provides practice data, research data.

title: Student-level course data — course
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{  # Load data data(course)  # Select specific rows and columns rows_we_want <- course$mcid == MCID3112192438 cols_we_want <- c(mcid, term_course, course, grade)  # View observations for this ID  course[rows_we_want, cols_we_want]  } # }

title: Student-level degree data — degree
text: Student-level degree information approximately 50,000 undergraduates earning degrees, keyed student ID. Data "student-level" refers information collected undergraduate institutions individual students, example, institution, program, term, baccalaureate degree.

title: Student-level degree data — degree
text: data.frame data.table 5 variables 49,543 observations unique students occupying 6 MB memory: mcid Character, anonymized student identifier, e.g., MCID3111142225. institution Character, de-identified institution name, e.g., Institution , Institution B, etc. term_degree Character, academic year term, format YYYYT, student completes program. cip6 Character, 6-digit CIP code program student earns degree, e.g., 090101, 141201, 260901, 420101, etc. degree Character, type degree awarded, e.g., Bachelor Arts Geography, Bachelor Science Finance, etc.

title: Student-level degree data — degree
text: 2022 MIDFIELD database

title: Student-level degree data — degree
text: Degree data structured block-record form, , records associated particular ID can span multiple rows—one record per student per degree. Multiple degrees can occur term different terms. Terms encoded YYYYT, YYYY year start academic year T encodes semester quarter within academic year Fall (1), Winter (2), Spring (3), Summer (4, 5, 6). example, academic year 1995–96, Fall 95–96 encoded 19951, Spring 95–96 encoded 19953, first Summer 95-96 term encoded 19954. source database includes special month-long sessions encoded letters , B, C, etc., though none included sample. program codes, midfielddata uses 2010 version Classification Instructional Programs (CIP). midfieldr package installed loaded, type ?cip details. data midfielddata proportionate stratified sample MIDFIELD database, suitable drawing inferences program attributes student experiences—midfielddata provides practice data, research data.

title: Student-level degree data — degree
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{  # Load data data(degree)  # Select specific rows and columns rows_we_want <- degree$mcid == MCID3112192438 cols_we_want <- c(mcid, term_degree, cip6, degree)  # View observations for this ID  degree[rows_we_want, cols_we_want]  } # }

title: midfielddata: MIDFIELD Data Sample — midfielddata-package
text: data package contains anonymized student-level records 98,000 undergraduates three US institutions 1988 2018 organized four data tables keyed student ID. Student-level data refers information collected undergraduate institutions individual students including demographics, programs academic standing term, individual courses, grades, degrees. data proportionate stratified sample MIDFIELD database, suitable drawing inferences program attributes student experiences—‘midfielddata’ provides practice data, research data.

title: midfielddata: MIDFIELD Data Sample — midfielddata-package
text: Maintainer: Richard Layton graphdoctor@gmail.com [copyright holder] Authors: Russell Long ralong@purdue.edu [copyright holder, data manager] Matthew Ohland ohland@purdue.edu [copyright holder] Marisa Orr marisak@clemson.edu [copyright holder] Susan Lord slord@sandiego.edu [copyright holder] contributors: US National Science Foundation [funder]

title: Student-level demographic data — student
text: Student-level demographic information approximately 98,000 degree-seeking undergraduate students, keyed student ID. Data "student-level" refers information collected undergraduate institutions individual students, example, age, sex, race/ethnicity matriculation.

title: Student-level demographic data — student
text: data.frame data.table 13 variables 97,555 observations unique students occupying 18 MB memory: mcid Character, anonymized student identifier, e.g., MCID3111142225. institution Character, de-identified institution name, e.g., Institution , Institution B, etc. transfer Character, transfer status, possible values First-Time College, First-Time Transfer. hours_transfer Numeric, number credit hours transferred (NA). race Character, race/ethnicity self-reported student, e.g., Asian, Black, Hispanic, etc. sex Character, sex self-reported student, possible values Female, Male, Unknown. age_desc Character, age group, possible values 25 Older, 25. us_citizen Character, US citizenship, possible values , Yes. home_zip Character, home ZIP code (NA), e.g., 02056, 20170, 51301, 80129, etc. high_school Character, code last high school attended admission (NA), e.g., 060075, 210512, 431800, 502195, etc. sat_math Numeric, SAT mathematics test score (NA). sat_verbal Numeric, SAT reading test score (NA). act_comp Numeric, ACT composite test score (NA).

title: Student-level demographic data — student
text: 2022 MIDFIELD database

title: Student-level demographic data — student
text: Student data structured row-record form, , information associated particular ID occupies single row—one record per student. data midfielddata proportionate stratified sample MIDFIELD database, suitable drawing inferences program attributes student experiences—midfielddata provides practice data, research data.

title: Student-level demographic data — student
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{  # Load data data(student)  # Select specific rows and columns rows_we_want <- student$mcid == MCID3112192438 cols_we_want <- c(mcid, institution, transfer, race, sex, age_desc)  # View observations for this ID  student[rows_we_want, cols_we_want]  } # }

title: Student-level term data — term
text: Student-level term information approximately 98,000 undergraduates, keyed student ID. Data "student-level" refers information collected undergraduate institutions individual students, example, program code, academic standing, grade point average term.

title: Student-level term data — term
text: data.frame data.table 13 variables approximately 640,000 observations 97,555 unique students occupying 73 MB memory: mcid Character, anonymized student identifier, e.g., MCID3111142225. institution Character, de-identified institution name, e.g., Institution , Institution B, etc. term Character, academic year term, format YYYYT. cip6 Character, 6-digit CIP code program student enrolled term, e.g., 090101, 141201, 260901, 420101, etc. level Character, academic level determined cumulative number credit earned, e.g., 01 First-year, 02 Second-year, etc. standing Character, academic standing, e.g., Good Standing, Academic Warning, etc. coop Character, cooperative education term, possible values Yes, . hours_term Numeric, credit hours earned term. hours_term_attempt Numeric, credit hours attempted term. hours_cumul Numeric, cumulative credit hours earned. hours_cumul_attempt Numeric, cumulative credit hours attempted. gpa_term Numeric, term grade point average. gpa_cumul Numeric, cumulative grade point average.

title: Student-level term data — term
text: 2022 MIDFIELD database

title: Student-level term data — term
text: Term data structured block-record form, , records associated particular ID can span multiple rows—one record per student per term. Terms encoded YYYYT, YYYY year start academic year T encodes semester quarter within academic year Fall (1), Winter (2), Spring (3), Summer (4, 5, 6). example, academic year 1995–96, Fall 95–96 encoded 19951, Spring 95–96 encoded 19953, first Summer 95-96 term encoded 19954. source database includes special month-long sessions encoded letters , B, C, etc., though none included sample. program codes, midfielddata uses 2010 version Classification Instructional Programs (CIP). midfieldr package installed loaded, type ?cip details. data midfielddata proportionate stratified sample MIDFIELD database, suitable drawing inferences program attributes student experiences—midfielddata provides practice data, research data.

title: Student-level term data — term
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{  # Load data data(term)  # Select specific rows and columns rows_we_want <- term$mcid == "MCID3112192438" cols_we_want <- c("mcid", "term", "cip6", "level", "standing", "gpa_cumul")  # View observations for this ID  term[rows_we_want, cols_we_want]   } # }
